content.title: Sclerotherapy for Venous Disease
content.description: Chemical ablation of superficial veins using injection of sclerosant agents to damage endothelium and cause fibrotic occlusion.

foam_sclerotherapy.mechanism: Microfoam displaces blood, increases contact time with vein wall
foam_sclerotherapy.preparation: Tessari method - 1:4 liquid to air ratio
foam_sclerotherapy.advantages: More effective for larger veins, lower volumes needed
foam_sclerotherapy.ugfs: Ultrasound-guided foam sclerotherapy for larger veins

indications.larger_veins: UGFS for truncal veins (alternative to thermal ablation)

technique.injection: Small volumes (0.1-0.5ml per site), multiple injections

complications.telangiectatic_matting: New small vessels at treatment site
complications.skin_necrosis: Rare, from extravasation or arterial injection
